intro: Maesa hirtella, commonly known as the hairy maesa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it the common name, and it has a woody stem with a rough texture. Maesa hirtella is part of the Ericaceae family, which includes other shrubs and evergreens adapted to acidic soils.
